title: What happens if Dems flip the House? What it would mean for Trump's presidency
shortDescription: Republicans are likely to keep the chamber. But if Democrats flip it, the next two years will be marked by opposition.

title: Trump says he won't ask Haley, Pompeo to join his second administration
shortDescription: Nikki Haley and Mike Pompeo both previously served in President-elect Donald Trump's first administration.

title: 5 reasons Trump may never be sentenced for New York felony convictions
shortDescription: After his election victory, here are five reasons why President-elect Donald Trump may never be sentenced in his New York criminal hush money case.

title: Trump called winner in Arizona, completing sweep of swing states
shortDescription: Arizona, famous for its extended post-election ballot count, on Saturday became the last state in the nation called in the 2024 presidential race.

title: FEMA says employee told aid workers to avoid homes with Trump signs
shortDescription: The employee, who was not named, was fired from her position, Administrator Deanne Criswell said in a post to social media on Saturday.

title: Biden and Trump to meet Wednesday after years of bitter rivalry
shortDescription: It will mark Trump's first return to Washington, D.C. since being elected the 47th president.

title: Trump Cabinet picks: Latest on who could could fill key positions
shortDescription: With Donald Trump headed back to the White House, he has a few months to build his next adminsitration. He has picked his chief of staff, who is next?

title: Jacky Rosen wins reelection in Nevada Senate race
shortDescription: Rosen is one of three Democratic senators from swing states to win despite Trump winning their state.

title: Democrats' working-class exodus poses long-term crisis for party
shortDescription: Democrats have long prided themselves as the party of the little guy. But Trump's victory saw working-class voters continue to flock from Democrats.

title: Election extremist activity was limited, but extremists are busy
shortDescription: Bomb threats and a suspected arson attack at the Capitol were the extremist events of the election. Also: a neo Nazi is arrested and racist texts.

title: Trump suddenly stopped alleging cheating as soon as he won
shortDescription: After making election fraud claims central to his claims, president-elect Trump has gone silent on the topic.

title: Why did Republicans lose Senate races in so many states Trump won?
shortDescription: Ticket-splitting used to be common and the swing-state down-ballot results show split tickets still can determine the outcome of key races.

title: Fear of 'scary' times ahead for some immigrants in Trump's return
shortDescription: Nearly one-third of Latino families in the US could be disrupted by Trump's immigration enforcement plan.

title: How cascading crises engulfed Joe Biden's final months as president
shortDescription: Joe Biden had mapped out a game plan for his final months as president. Then a series of cascading crises intruded.

title: DOJ files discrimination suit against Mississippi Senate for low pay
shortDescription: Friday's lawsuit alleges Kristie Metcalfe, the only Black attorney at the Mississippi State Senate, was paid about half the salary of her colleagues.

title: Tim Walz gives first remarks since losing to Trump and Vance
shortDescription: After the Republican ticket's decisive presidential victory Tuesday, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz returned home to thank his supporters.

title: No proof Kamala Harris said she'd skip Trump inauguration | Fact check
shortDescription: There is no credible evidence of Harris saying that. She has said the current administration will assist in the transition to Trump's second term.

title: No, CBS didn't accuse Trump of cheating in 2024 election | Fact check
shortDescription: There is no evidence to support the claim on CBS News' website or social media accounts, and a spokesperson for the network said the claim is false.

title: Harris voters concerned for the future
shortDescription: Harris was supposed to be President Joe Biden's political heir. Was she thrust into the spotlight too soon?

title: Post distorts inactive Colorado law about electoral votes | Fact check
shortDescription: The law was not active in 2024. If it takes effect, it will commit states to award their electoral votes to the national popular vote winner.

title: Trump Cabinet picks: What to know after Susie Wiles named chief of staff
shortDescription: With Donald Trump headed back to the White House, he has a few months to build his next adminsitration. He has picked his chief of staff, who is next?

title: Elon Musk joins Trump's first call with Ukrainian president Zelenskyy
shortDescription: Media reports say Musk, the world's richest man and a key Trump election backer, just happened to be in the room when Trump talked to Zelenskyy.

title: What to expect from a GOP trifecta | The Excerpt
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump pledged to follow though with mass deportations, in an interview with NBC News. This and more stories on The Excerpt.

title: How did Trump sweep the swing states?
shortDescription: Journalists from the USA TODAY network shared how former President Donald Trump took the key swing states in the 2024 elections.
